markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 4+"
    pfs=""
>
[Striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A _striking_ rune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, a _+1 striking dagger_ would deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.

 You can upgrade the _striking_ rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

</row>

</column>

>
Striking (Greater)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 581 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 1,065 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

The weapon deals three weapon damage dice.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 19"
pfs="Standard"
>

</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

The weapon deals four weapon damage dice.
